traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

# Instruction
You need to act as an agent that use the above tools to help the user according to the above policy.

At each step, your generation should have exactly the following format:
Thought:
<A single line of reasoning to process the context and inform the decision making. Do not include extra lines.>
Action:
{"name": <The name of the action>, "arguments": <The arguments to the action in json format>}

The Action will be parsed, so it must be valid JSON.

You should not use made-up or placeholder arguments.

For example, if the user says "I want to know the current weather of San Francisco", and there is such a tool available
{
    "type": "function",
    "function": {
        "name": "get_current_weather",
        "description": "Get the current weather",
        "parameters": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
                "location": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "description": "The city and state, e.g. San Francisco, CA",
                },
                "format": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "enum": ["celsius", "fahrenheit"],
                    "description": "The temperature unit to use. Infer this from the users location.",
                },
            },
            "required": ["location", "format"],
        },
    }
}

Your response can be like this:
Thought:
Since the user asks for the weather of San Francisco in USA, the unit should be in fahrenheit. I can query get_current_weather to get the weather.
Action:
{"name": "get_current_weather", "arguments": {"location": "San Francisco, CA", "format": "fahrenheit"}}

And if the tool returns "70F", your response can be:
Thought:
I can answer the user now.
Action:
{"name": respond, "arguments": {"content": "The current weather of San Francisco is 70F."}}

task.instruction: You are 'daiki_muller_1116'. You want to cancel your upcoming flights within reservation IDs XEHM4B and 59XX6W. If the agent says either of the two reservations have basic economy flights, ask to upgrade them to economy first and then cancel them. You are very persistent and terse but clear. In the middle of the conversation after the third agent message, you also want to check if you have any other upcoming flights and ask for what the total cost of those flights are.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

# Instruction
You need to act as an agent that use the above tools to help the user according to the above policy.

At each step, your generation should have exactly the following format:
Thought:
<A single line of reasoning to process the context and inform the decision making. Do not include extra lines.>
Action:
{"name": <The name of the action>, "arguments": <The arguments to the action in json format>}

The Action will be parsed, so it must be valid JSON.

You should not use made-up or placeholder arguments.

For example, if the user says "I want to know the current weather of San Francisco", and there is such a tool available
{

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

You need to act as an agent that use the above tools to help the user according to the above policy.

Thought:
<A single line of reasoning to process the context and inform the decision making. Do not include extra lines.>
Action:
{"name": <The name of the action>, "arguments": <The arguments to the action in json format>}

The Action will be parsed, so it must be valid JSON.

You should not use made-up or placeholder arguments.

For example, if the user says "I want to know the current weather of San Francisco", and there is such a tool available
{
    "type": "function",
    "function": {
        "name": "get_current_weather",
        "description": "Get the current weather",
        "parameters": {
            "type": "object",

                    "type": "string",
                    "enum": ["celsius", "fahrenheit"],
                    "description": "The temperature unit to use. Infer this from the users location.",
                },
            },
            "required": ["location", "format"],
        },
    }
}

Your response can be like this:
Thought:
Since the user asks for the weather of San Francisco in USA, the unit should be in fahrenheit. I can query get_current_weather to get the weather.
Action:
{"name": "get_current_weather", "arguments": {"location": "San Francisco, CA", "format": "fahrenheit"}}

And if the tool returns "70F", your response can be:
Thought:
I can answer the user now.
Action:
{"name": respond, "arguments": {"content": "The current weather of San Francisco is 70F."}}

Try to be helpful and always follow the policy.
Hi, I need help with getting a refund for the insurance I bought for my flight.

Yes, please connect me with someone who can help with this.

Action:

And if the tool returns "70F", your response can be:

Action:

Hi, I need to cancel my flight.

Thought:
The user wants to cancel their flight, so I need to ask for their user ID, reservation ID, and reason for cancellation to proceed with the cancellation process.
Action:
{"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I'd be happy to help you cancel your flight. Can you please provide me with your user ID, the reservation ID of the flight you'd like to cancel, and the reason for cancellation?"}}
Sure, my user ID is sophia_silva_7557, and the reservation ID is H8Q05L. I'm canceling because it coincides with an important event.

Thought:
I need to get the reservation details to check if the flight can be cancelled based on the airline's cancellation policy.
Action:
{"name": "get_reservation_details", "arguments": {"reservation_id": "H8Q05L"}}

API output: {"reservation_id": "H8Q05L", "user_id": "sophia_silva_7557", "origin": "JFK", "destination": "ATL", "flight_type": "one_way", "cabin": "basic_economy", "flights": [{"origin": "JFK", "destination": "ATL", "flight_number": "HAT268", "date": "2024-05-24", "price": 74}], "passengers": [{"first_name": "Harper", "last_name": "Kovacs", "dob": "1973-10-26"}], "payment_history": [{"payment_id": "credit_card_4196779", "amount": 104}], "created_at": "2024-05-03T15:12:00", "total_baggages": 0, "nonfree_baggages": 0, "insurance": "yes"}

Thought:
Since the reservation was created on 2024-05-03 and today is 2024-05-15, it's been more than 24 hours since the booking. The cabin is basic economy, but the user has travel insurance, so I need to ask if the reason for cancellation is due to health or weather reasons to determine if the flight can be cancelled.
Action:
{"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I've checked your reservation details. You have a basic economy ticket with travel insurance. To proceed with the cancellation, can you please confirm if the reason for cancellation is due to health or weather reasons?"}}
The cancellation is due to a personal reason that's very important to me.

Thought:
The user's reason for cancellation is not due to health or weather reasons, so the travel insurance does not apply. Since it's a basic economy ticket and more than 24 hours have passed since booking, the flight cannot be cancelled.
Action:
{"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I understand that the reason for cancellation is important to you, but unfortunately, our policy does not allow for cancellations of basic economy tickets more than 24 hours after booking unless it's due to health or weather reasons. I'm going to have to transfer you to a human agent to see if they can assist you further."}}
I really prefer not to be transferred. Can we handle this here, please?

Thought:
I need to reiterate that the policy does not allow for cancellations in this case, and I'm not authorized to make exceptions. I should politely but firmly explain the situation again.
Action:
{"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I understand your preference, but I apologize that our policy does not allow for cancellations of basic economy tickets more than 24 hours after booking unless it's due to health or weather reasons. I'm not authorized to make exceptions or override this policy. If you'd like to explore other options or discuss possible alternatives, I can try to assist you, but cancellation is not possible through this channel."}}
I would appreciate if you could provide a full refund, as this event is very special to me.

Thought:
I need to reiterate that a refund is not possible in this case, as the policy clearly states that basic economy tickets are non-refundable more than 24 hours after booking unless it's due to health or weather reasons. I should not offer false hope or promise a refund that I'm not authorized to provide.
Action:
{"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I understand that the event is special to you, and I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. However, I must reiterate that our policy does not allow for refunds of basic economy tickets more than 24 hours after booking unless it's due to health or weather reasons. I'm not authorized to provide a refund or make exceptions to this policy. If you'd like to discuss possible alternatives or explore other options, I'm here to assist you, but a refund is not possible in this case."}}
I would really appreciate it if you could find a way to help me with a full refund.

Thought:
I've already explained the policy and my limitations as an agent. The user is still requesting a refund that I'm not authorized to provide. I should transfer the user to a human agent who may be able to review the case and provide a more personalized solution.
Action:
{"name": "transfer_to_human_agents", "arguments": {"summary": "User is requesting a full refund for a basic economy ticket more than 24 hours after booking due to a personal event. I've explained the policy, but the user is still seeking a refund."}}
API output: Transfer successful

task.instruction: You are Sophia Silva (with ID: sophia_silva_7557). Mention that you're a valued Gold member and that your flight earlier this month was canceled, which caused you to miss an important meeting. You want to receive compensation for the missed meeting and the inconvenience caused by the cancellation.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

Action:

The Action will be parsed, so it must be valid JSON.

You should not use made-up or placeholder arguments.

For example, if the user says "I want to know the current weather of San Francisco", and there is such a tool available
{
    "type": "function",

                    "description": "The temperature unit to use. Infer this from the users location.",
                },
            },
            "required": ["location", "format"],
        },
    }
}

Your response can be like this:

Since the user asks for the weather of San Francisco in USA, the unit should be in fahrenheit. I can query get_current_weather to get the weather.
Action:
{"name": "get_current_weather", "arguments": {"location": "San Francisco, CA", "format": "fahrenheit"}}

And if the tool returns "70F", your response can be:
Thought:
I can answer the user now.
Action:
{"name": respond, "arguments": {"content": "The current weather of San Francisco is 70F."}}

Try to be helpful and always follow the policy.

Thought: I have retrieved the reservation details, and the user has a one-way basic economy flight from MCO to SFO with a layover in PHX, so I need to ask what kind of assistance they require with this flight.
Action: {"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "Thank you for providing the reservation ID, Anya. You have a one-way basic economy flight from Orlando to San Francisco with a layover in Phoenix. What kind of assistance do you need with this flight? Do you need to change or cancel it, or do you have a question about the reservation?"}}
I'd like to cancel the flight, please. Unfortunately, I won't be able to make it since I'm sick.

Thought: The user wants to cancel the flight due to illness, so I need to check if the cancellation is allowed according to the airline's policies, considering the user's membership status, flight type, and travel insurance.
Action: {"name": "think", "arguments": {"thought": "The user is a silver member with a basic economy flight and no travel insurance. Basic economy flights can only be cancelled within 24 hours of booking or if the airline cancelled the flight. Since the flight was booked on 2024-05-02 and today is 2024-05-15, the 24-hour window has passed. I need to inform the user of the airline's policies and the potential consequences of cancellation."}}
API output:

Thought: Based on the airline's policies, I need to inform the user that cancellation of their basic economy flight is not allowed due to illness, and they will likely not receive a refund.
Action: {"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I understand that you're unable to make the flight due to illness, but unfortunately, as per our airline's policies, basic economy flights can only be cancelled within 24 hours of booking or if the airline cancelled the flight. Since the 24-hour window has passed, cancellation is not allowed, and you will likely not receive a refund. However, I can offer to transfer you to a human agent who can review your case and see if there are any alternative options available. Would you like me to do that?"}}
I purchased insurance for this flight, which should cover cancellations due to illness. Can I still get a refund?

Thought: The user claims to have purchased insurance for the flight, but according to the reservation details I retrieved earlier, they did not purchase insurance. I need to clarify this discrepancy with the user.
Action: {"name": "respond", "arguments": {"content": "I apologize, but according to the reservation details I have, it appears that you did not purchase insurance for this flight. The 'insurance' field is marked as 'no'. Can you please provide more information or clarify if there was an error with your insurance purchase?"}}
I'm positive that I purchased insurance for this flight. There might be an error, but I definitely selected the insurance option.

Thought: The user is certain that they purchased insurance, but the system shows otherwise. I need to transfer the user to a human agent who can investigate this discrepancy and assist with the cancellation and potential refund.
Action: {"name": "transfer_to_human_agents", "arguments": {"summary": "User is attempting to cancel a basic economy flight due to illness and claims to have purchased insurance, but system shows no insurance was purchased. User needs assistance with cancellation and potential refund."}}
API output: Transfer successful

task.instruction: You are Anya Garcia (with ID: anya_garcia_5901). Mention that you booked the flight (with confirmation 3RK2T9) and you want to change the passenger name on the reservation. You want to change the name from Mei Lee to Mei Garcia. Be insistent and don't provide more information than necessary.

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

#Available tools

traj.content:
# Airline Agent Policy

The current time is 2024-05-15 15:00:00 EST.

As an airline agent, you can help users book, modify, or cancel flight reservations.

- Before taking any actions that update the booking database (booking, modifying flights, editing baggage, upgrading cabin class, or updating passenger information), you must list the action details and obtain explicit user confirmation (yes) to proceed.

- You should not provide any information, knowledge, or procedures not provided by the user or available tools, or give subjective recommendations or comments.

- You should only make one tool call at a time, and if you make a tool call, you should not respond to the user simultaneously. If you respond to the user, you should not make a tool call at the same time.

- You should deny user requests that are against this policy.

- You should transfer the user to a human agent if and only if the request cannot be handled within the scope of your actions.

## Domain Basic

- Each user has a profile containing user id, email, addresses, date of birth, payment methods, reservation numbers, and membership tier.

- Each reservation has an reservation id, user id, trip type (one way, round trip), flights, passengers, payment methods, created time, baggages, and travel insurance information.

- Each flight has a flight number, an origin, destination, scheduled departure and arrival time (local time), and for each date:
  - If the status is "available", the flight has not taken off, available seats and prices are listed.
  - If the status is "delayed" or "on time", the flight has not taken off, cannot be booked.
  - If the status is "flying", the flight has taken off but not landed, cannot be booked.

## Book flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, then ask for the trip type, origin, destination.

- Passengers: Each reservation can have at most five passengers. The agent needs to collect the first name, last name, and date of birth for each passenger. All passengers must fly the same flights in the same cabin.

- Payment: each reservation can use at most one travel certificate, at most one credit card, and at most three gift cards. The remaining amount of a travel certificate is not refundable. All payment methods must already be in user profile for safety reasons.

- Checked bag allowance: If the booking user is a regular member, 0 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 1 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 2 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a silver member, 1 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 2 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. If the booking user is a gold member, 2 free checked bag for each basic economy passenger, 3 free checked bag for each economy passenger, and 3 free checked bags for each business passenger. Each extra baggage is 50 dollars.

- Travel insurance: the agent should ask if the user wants to buy the travel insurance, which is 30 dollars per passenger and enables full refund if the user needs to cancel the flight given health or weather reasons.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

## Modify flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id and the reservation id.

- Change flights: Basic economy flights cannot be modified. Other reservations can be modified without changing the origin, destination, and trip type. Some flight segments can be kept, but their prices will not be updated based on the current price. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- Change cabin: all reservations, including basic economy, can change cabin without changing the flights. Cabin changes require the user to pay for the difference between their current cabin and the new cabin class. Cabin class must be the same across all the flights in the same reservation; changing cabin for just one flight segment is not possible.

- Change baggage and insurance: The user can add but not remove checked bags. The user cannot add insurance after initial booking.

- Change passengers: The user can modify passengers but cannot modify the number of passengers. This is something that even a human agent cannot assist with.

- Payment: If the flights are changed, the user needs to provide one gift card or credit card for payment or refund method. The agent should ask for the payment or refund method instead.

## Cancel flight

- The agent must first obtain the user id, the reservation id, and the reason for cancellation (change of plan, airline cancelled flight, or other reasons)

- All reservations can be cancelled within 24 hours of booking, or if the airline cancelled the flight. Otherwise, basic economy or economy flights can be cancelled only if travel insurance is bought and the condition is met, and business flights can always be cancelled. The rules are strict regardless of the membership status. The API does not check these for the agent, so the agent must make sure the rules apply before calling the API!

- The agent can only cancel the whole trip that is not flown. If any of the segments are already used, the agent cannot help and transfer is needed.

- The refund will go to original payment methods in 5 to 7 business days.

## Refund

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about cancelled flights in a reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts, with the amount being $100 times the number of passengers.

- If the user is silver/gold member or has travel insurance or flies business, and complains about delayed flights in a reservation and wants to change or cancel the reservation, the agent can offer a certificate as a gesture after confirming the facts and changing or cancelling the reservation, with the amount being $50 times the number of passengers.

- Do not proactively offer these unless the user complains about the situation and explicitly asks for some compensation. Do not compensate if the user is regular member and has no travel insurance and flies (basic) economy.

You should not use made-up or placeholder arguments.

Halfway through the book flight process, abruptly mention that you would like to talk about something else by saying that you are frustrated with the delayed flight in your most recent reservation.
